185059747.review: the story is not great. but if you play this game as an open world superhero game its a great game. flying or gliding around the city is fun. this game is great even with its age. there is nothing close to this game for dc fans. other then arkham series. i do lots of free roam in this game. you can come across the odd crimes on patrol. the city is full of people and cars and it really makes you feel like your protecting a real city. if you got the cash to burn you can even have your own batcave or fortress of ice.

184990413.review:
Alright, let’s don our capes and dive into the colorful chaos of DC Universe Online!

Picture this: you’re zooming through the skies of Metropolis, laser eyes ready to obliterate any baddies that dare cross your path. Sounds thrilling, right? Well, DC Universe Online definitely delivers on the superhero fantasy... mostly. As an MMORPG set in the sprawling DC Universe, it offers players the chance to live out their comic book dreams by creating their own superhero or supervillain. But, like any good comic book plot, it’s not without its ups and downs.

First off, character customization is a blast. You get to mix and match powers and outfits to create your ultimate alter ego. Fancy yourself a hybrid of Batman and The Flash? Go for it! Just be prepared to spend an eternity in the character creation screen, because, let’s be honest, the options are as overwhelming as Gotham’s crime rate.

Once you’ve finally crafted your superhero, the game launches you into a world brimming with iconic locations and familiar faces. There’s something undeniably cool about fighting alongside (or against) legends like Superman and The Joker. However, the excitement starts to wear thin when you realize that the missions can be as repetitive as a broken record. Sure, saving the day never gets old, but how many times can you collect X number of items or defeat Y number of enemies before it feels like déjà vu?

The combat is decent, with a mix of button-mashing and strategic use of powers, but it can get a bit clunky, especially when dealing with a screen full of chaotic effects. And while the graphics are decent enough to bring the DC Universe to life, they’re not exactly jaw-dropping – think more comic book-inspired rather than cutting-edge realism.

One of the best aspects of DC Universe Online is the community. Fellow players are friendly and eager to team up for raids, making it feel like you’re part of a super squad. Plus, the developers regularly release updates and events to keep things fresh, so there’s always something new to look forward to.

So, while DC Universe Online might not be perfect, it’s still a fun way to spend an afternoon living out your superhero fantasies. Just be prepared for a few bumps in the road – or should I say, in the flight path. 🦸‍♂️🦸‍♀️🦹‍♂️

Happy hero-ing! 🦇✨🕶️

184843756.review: Great gameplay and customisation , loads of content

184786040.review:
It is a little shitty that a lot of the best options for not just character creation but also just crafting, assisting characters and whatever are trapped behind a paywall but for 2011 it's not that bad as earlier predecessors of MMORPGs like Wizard101 where you can't even complete the main story without hitting a paywall. I've played for 3 hours already at the time of this review and am yet to hit a serious paywall that says "You can't complete a main storyline mission unless you fork over your entire life savings!" Which is always great.

Sometimes chat can get a bit annoying but I always just switch over to the loot chat and it's much quieter.

184781152.review: I have not played this at all since 2011. Which was always on PS3. This game brings back so many memories from when I was a teenager, Me and an old friend from High School used to play together. Its so crazy that this game is still up. I'm glad it is. I've been playing a lot of classics lately that give me nostalgia. I'm glad DC Universe is still around. I noticed there is still a really good amount of online players playing this today. I see more player traffic during the day then at night. This game is still just as I remember. Just without my old friend. Its been YEARS!

184697491.review:
Hübsches Spiel. Nicht so großartig wie weiland City of Heroes, aber auch nicht schlecht. Etwas arg eng bei der optischen Charaktergestaltung und gnadenlos unübersichtlich bei den Fähigkeiten. Ist aber leicht genug, als dass man einfach loslegen kann und Spaß haben. die bekannten Figuren helfen sehr dabei dass es lebendig ist.

Es gibt vielerlei kleine Macken im Text. Erklärungen und Support sind arg knapp. Durch die lange Laufzeit gibt es Unmengen an Material, so dass zumindest in den ersten 100 Stunden garantiert kein Grind-Gefühl aufkommt (Weiter bin ich noch nicht). Man merkt die Fremium-Natur an den begrenzten Inventarplätzen, gleichzeitig wird man aber so mit neuen Teilen zugeschüttet, dass Wegwerfen auch kein Problem ist. Kann sein, dass ich irgendwann das Geld ausgeben werde um die Zahlsachen zu bekommen, noch gehts aber flüssig ohne.

Ein Muss für jeden der Superhelden und Story wie in Heftchen mag. Nicht unbedingt für die Leute die die neueste HDR Grafik brauchen ... und weg zum weiterspielen :))

Lo jugué por mucho mas tiempo cuando no usaba Steam, todavía tengo la misma cuenta.

Es una buena experiencia cuando lo juegas por primera vez, al volver después de varios años, sigue siendo bueno, pero a día de hoy no me gusta estar limitado por el espacio del inventario, o tener limite de objetivos diarios, que no me dejan abrir una caja si no juego cada día.

En resumen, si te gustan los MMO y juegos de celular con objetivos diarios, este te va a gustar, porque aparte de eso, lo que es el juego en si, es muy bueno, y la historia es facil de seguir.

183735857.review:
É um jogo que eu gosto, especialmente pela chance de criar meu próprio herói (ou vilão) e mergulhar no universo da DC. A sensação de voar por Metrópolis, lutar ao lado de ícones como Batman e Mulher-Maravilha, ou enfrentar inimigos lendários é legal. A narrativa é divertida, e o combate é fluido, com um toque de ação que mantém as batalhas dinâmicas.

Mas, apesar de todo o carinho que tenho pelo jogo, não posso recomendá-lo tão facilmente. A interface e os gráficos mostram a idade, e o modelo de monetização pode ser desanimador para quem quer progredir sem gastar. Ele brilha mais para fãs da DC que estão dispostos a relevar suas falhas em troca da imersão no universo. Para outros jogadores, talvez a experiência não valha tanto o esforço.

183678644.review: Movement and combat mechanics are surprisingly pretty fun. The story has cool moving comic book panels for the main missions. The problem is that the content is very repetitive and brainless. Most of the cooler powers are locked behind DLC too. Definitly worth trying it out for being free.
